title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 February 2017 - XWiki
content:
<lBowlin> has joined #xwiki  
01:43 <lBowlin> Hey all, I'm having issues with the xWiki 9.0 install on Ubuntu 16.04. I'd like to just go back to installing xWiki 8.4.x, is this still available and how would I point apt to the old version. Thanks!

10:10 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol> has quit  
10:33 <rahulkumar> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <rahulkumar> Hello all,I want to contribute to projects .Can anyone help me with providing sample bugs ?  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> rahulkumar: hi  
10:38 <gdelhumeau> This is a list of bugs: http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=project%20in%20(XWIKI%2C%20XRENDERING%2C%20XCOMMONS%2C%20XE)%20AND%20issuetype%20%3D%20Bug%20AND%20status%20in%20(Verified%2C%20Open%2C%20Reopened)  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> everything is logged into "jira"  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> you can pick one of them and try to fix  
10:39 <rahulkumar> thanks,will look into it.  
10:39 <gdelhumeau> now it really depends on your skills: front end, back-end, etc...  
10:40 <rahulkumar> I am more of fron-end guy  
10:40 <rahulkumar> I am good with react  
10:40 <rahulkumar> Is there any project that is using react as front-end ?  
10:40 <Pbas> Hello, here you are: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> We don't use react  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> we have angular in some extensions (file manager for instance)  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> or knockout-js in the Nested Pages Migrator (that I am refactoring)  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> but no react  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> we now use jQuery  
10:43 <rahulkumar> Do you have any particular project good for beginners ?  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> I can think of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13967  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> but the link given by Pbas is a good start  
10:55 <rahulkumar> has quit  
11:14 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:35 <vmassol1> has quit  
12:49 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
12:49 <KermitTheFragger> hi all! Is it possible to register new servlet from an XWiki component? Trying to add a servlet which prints out SAML metadata for an IDP to consume  
12:55 <gdelhumeau> I don't think so  
12:55 <gdelhumeau> Maybe with the URL module you can register a new type of resource  
13:11 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki

13:45 <msmeria1> has quit  
13:46 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <edvorg> has quit  
14:07 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <M-cjd> has quit  
14:10 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <M-cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <msmeria> has quit  
14:38 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <KermitTheFragger> gdelhumeau: sorry didn't notice your response.  
14:48 <KermitTheFragger> gdelhumeau: So if I would need something like that for SAML support (metadata download, Single Sign Out callback URL, etc.) I would need to "patch" XWiki directly?  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> I think you should ask vmassol  
14:48 <gdelhumeau> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/URL+Architecture  
14:49 <KermitTheFragger> gdelhumeau: ah thanks! looks interesting, im going to dive into that  
14:49 <tmortagne> KermitTheFragger: you really need a servlet or any entry point would do ?  
14:49 <KermitTheFragger> tmortagne: I think any entry point would do  
14:50 <tmortagne> I don't think you can register a servlet at runtime but there is other ways in XWiki to answer to specific URLs  
14:50 <KermitTheFragger> tmortagne: I do need access to some post data in case of a single logout request but thats it  
14:51 <KermitTheFragger> the URL to the document gdelhumeau pasted looks promising  
14:51 <gdelhumeau> that's how the webjar resources are handled  
14:52 <tmortagne> there is two way:  
14:52 <tmortagne> \* a REST resource module (which will be an URL under /xwiki/rest/...)  
14:53 <tmortagne> for REST module you can look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XWikiRESTfulAPI#HCustomresources  
14:55 <tmortagne> for the generic resource API an example you can look at is https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/oidc/blob/master/oidc-provider/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/provider/internal/OIDCResourceReferenceHandler.java  
14:55 <tmortagne> it's actually more generic even than HTTP but the example I gave you manipulate HTTP request/response  
14:55 <tmortagne> (it's an OpenID Connect provider)  
14:57 <KermitTheFragger> tmortagne: thanks! I'll look in to it!

16:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:52 <vmassol> hi everyone  
16:53 <vmassol> FYI I've created the first pipeline library at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-jenkins-pipeline/blob/master/vars/xwikiModule.groovy  
16:53 <vmassol> and here's how to use it (FTM): https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown/blob/master/Jenkinsfile  
16:54 <vmassol> simple, isn't it? :)  
16:54 <vmassol> ah wait  
16:54 <vmassol> forgot to push  
16:54 <vmassol> ;)  
16:54 <vmassol> so not sure yet if it works  
16:54 <vmassol> testing...  
16:56 <vmassol> ok so not working yet, fixing ;)  
16:56 <vmassol> but here's how it should look like for the usage: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown/blob/master/Jenkinsfile  
16:56 <vmassol> actually with a bit more work even the name could be omitted  
17:00 <tmortagne1> vmassol: cool, finishing to fix http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14003 and I will try it in confluence repository  
17:01 <vmassol> tmortagne1: ok, I'll ping you when it fully works, right now the build is waiting for an agent :)  
17:01 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/syntax-markdown/job/master/4/console  
17:01 <tmortagne1> ok  
17:01 <tmortagne1> hmm  
17:01 <tmortagne1> has quit  
17:02 <vmassol> famous lard word :)  
17:02 <vmassol> \*last  
17:02 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:02 <tmortagne> better  
17:02 <vmassol> ok though you had aliased "hmm" to "exit" ;)  
17:02 <vmassol> \*thought  
17:03 <tmortagne> no I was just commenting by user id in the chat  
17:03 <tmortagne> (was quicker to reconnect than searching the IRC command to switch user)  
17:03 <vmassol>  / nick  
17:03 <vmassol> (for next time)  
17:04 <tmortagne> (pretty sure I will have forgotten next time too)  
17:04 <vmassol> :)  
17:24 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:25 <evalica> has quit  
17:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: it's working now ;)  
17:30 <vmassol> you can try it`  
17:31 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok thanks  
17:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: do I need to do anything on Jenkins side for my new file to be taken into account ?  
17:36 <vmassol> nope :)  
17:36 <vmassol> should be magical  
17:36 <tmortagne> ok  
17:36 <tmortagne> let's see  
17:37 <vmassol> once you push it it should start building  
17:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: does not seems to work  
17:42 <tmortagne> not listed in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/  
17:42 <vmassol> it's possibler that the first time it needs a nudge  
17:42 <vmassol> let me kick it  
17:42 <vmassol> and that resacn of org is not automatic  
17:43 <tmortagne> you are doing " Re-scan Organization" ?  
17:43 <vmassol> I triggered a rescan  
17:43 <vmassol> yes  
17:43 <tmortagne> maybe this could be put in some job  
17:43 <vmassol> yes it could  
17:43 <vmassol> need to google it first  
17:43 <vmassol> to see how it's supposed to behave  
17:44 <tmortagne> now we need a way to get the build status in the README  
17:44 <vmassol> seems it's under heavy redesign: https://jenkins.io/blog/2017/01/17/scm-api-2/  
17:44 <vmassol> that's easy for the build status  
17:45 <vmassol> https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Embeddable+Build+Status+Plugin for ex  
17:45 <sagarhani> has quit  
17:45 <tmortagne> I know about that  
17:46 <tmortagne> the issue is how you target this new kind of job  
17:46 <vmassol> it says it suopports pipelines but don't know if org folder is supported  
17:46 <tmortagne> you have the wrong one in https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown for example  
17:46 <vmassol> indeed  
17:47 <vmassol> I removerd that job  
17:47 <vmassol> I forgot about the badge  
17:48 <vmassol> fixing  
17:48 <tmortagne> vmassol: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/confluence/  
17:48 <tmortagne> cool  
17:49 <vmassol> I've updated https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown  
17:49 <vmassol> to find your badge you can go to http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/confluence/job/master/  
17:49 <vmassol> and then click on "http://ci.xwiki.org/job/XWiki%20Contrib/job/confluence/job/master/badge"  
17:50 <vmassol> grrr  
17:50 <vmassol> click on "Embeddable Build Status"  
17:52 <vmassol> I'm adding new options to the library now  
17:55 <vmassol> hmmm I need to fix the goals too  
17:55 <vmassol> should be clean deploy and not clean install  
17:55 <vmassol> hmm no  
17:55 <vmassol> it's the faq app job that needs fixing ;)  
17:56 <vmassol> then I'll need to handle the false positives for the email notif too…  
18:05 <tmortagne> vmassol: "clean deploy" makes more sense to me as default goals  
18:05 <tmortagne> that's what we do 99% of the time  
18:06 <vmassol> yes you're right, the agents should push to the maven repo located on the jenkins master  
18:06 <vmassol> changing that  
18:07 <vmassol> done  
18:07 <vmassol> I've also added some features  
18:07 <vmassol> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-jenkins-pipeline/commit/3cc9ab0bc62560052ef816f9dbed4a2fd71686cf  
18:08 <tmortagne> yep saw it  
18:09 <tmortagne> not sure about Xvnc by default  
18:09 <vmassol> yeah I know, ideally I wanted a config such as xvnc = true| false  
18:09 <vmassol> but I need to find out how to do it cleanly  
18:09 <vmassol> and FTM it doesn't harm much  
18:09 <tmortagne> ok  
18:09 <vmassol> right now I'm converting application-faq  
18:10 <vmassol> to use a Jenkinsfile  
18:10 <vmassol> and it has func tests  
18:12 <Pbas> has quit  
18:20 <vmassol> works, removing the faq app specific job  
18:21 <vmassol> plenty more to convert: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Contrib/ ;)
